ca_certificate_path.description: This is the file path for server CA certificates if they are not available on the host OS.

config_path.description: This is the file path for Aqua provider configuration. The default configuration path is ~/.aqua/tf.config

verify_tls.description: If true, server tls certificates will be verified by the client before making a connection. Defaults to true.

allowed_executables.description: List of executables that are allowed for the user.

application_scopes.description: Indicates the application scope of the service.

audit_all_network_activity.description: If true, all network activity will be audited.

audit_all_processes_activity.description: If true, all process activity will be audited.

audit_full_command_arguments.description: If true, full command arguments will be audited.

author.description: Username of the account that created the service.

block_access_host_network.description: If true, prevent containers from running with access to host network.

block_adding_capabilities.description: If true, prevent containers from running with adding capabilities with `--cap-add` privilege.

block_container_exec.description: If true, exec into a container is prevented.

block_low_port_binding.description: If true, prevent containers from running with the capability to bind in port lower than 1024.

block_non_compliant_images.description: If true, running non-compliant image in the container is prevented.

block_non_compliant_workloads.description: If true, running containers in non-compliant pods is prevented.

block_privileged_containers.description: If true, prevent containers from running with privileged container capability.

block_root_user.description: If true, prevent containers from running with root user.

block_unregistered_images.description: If true, running images in the container that are not registered in Aqua is prevented.

block_use_ipc_namespace.description: If true, prevent containers from running with the privilege to use the IPC namespace.

block_use_pid_namespace.description: If true, prevent containers from running with the privilege to use the PID namespace.

block_use_user_namespace.description: If true, prevent containers from running with the privilege to use the user namespace.

block_use_uts_namespace.description: If true, prevent containers from running with the privilege to use the UTS namespace.

blocked_capabilities.description: If true, prevents containers from using specific Unix capabilities.

blocked_executables.description: List of executables that are prevented from running in containers.

blocked_files.description: List of files that are prevented from being read, modified and executed in the containers.

blocked_packages.description: Prevent containers from reading, writing, or executing all files in the list of packages.

blocked_volumes.description: List of volumes that are prevented from being mounted in the containers.

description.description: The description of the container runtime policy

enable_drift_prevention.description: If true, executables that are not in the original image is prevented from running.

enable_fork_guard.description: If true, fork bombs are prevented in the containers.

enable_ip_reputation_security.description: If true, detect and prevent communication from containers to IP addresses known to have a bad reputation.

enable_port_scan_detection.description: If true, detects port scanning behavior in the container.

enabled.description: Indicates if the runtime policy is enabled or not.

enforce.description: Indicates that policy should effect container execution (not just for audit).

enforce_after_days.description: Indicates the number of days after which the runtime policy will be changed to enforce mode.

exceptional_readonly_files_and_directori.description: List of files and directories to be excluded from the read-only list.

fork_guard_process_limit.description: Process limit for the fork guard.

limit_new_privileges.description: If true, prevents the container from obtaining new privileges at runtime. (only enabled in enforce mode)

name.description: Name of the container runtime policy

readonly_files_and_directories.description: List of files and directories to be restricted as read-only

scope_expression.description: Logical expression of how to compute the dependency of the scope variables.

author.description: Username of the account that created the policy.

block_icmp_ping.description: Indicates whether policy includes blocking incoming 'ping' requests.

block_metadata_service.description: Indicates whether policy includes blocking metadata services of the cloud.

lastupdate.description: Timestamp of the last update in Unix time format.

name.description: Name of the policy, no longer than 128 characters and no slash characters.

type.description: Indicates the class of protection defined by the firewall.

allow.description: Indicates whether the specified resources are allowed to pass in data or requests.

port_range.description: Range of ports affected by firewall.

block.description: Information on network addresses that are allowed to pass in data or requests.

allow.description: Indicates whether the specified resources are allowed to receive data or requests.

port_range.description: Range of ports affected by firewall.

block.description: Information on network addresses that are allowed to receive data or requests.

application_scopes.description: Indicates the application scope of the service.

author.description: Username of the account that created the service.

block_malicious_executables.description: If true, prevent creation of malicious executables in functions during their runtime post invocation.

blocked_executables.description: List of executables that are prevented from running in containers.

description.description: The description of the function runtime policy

enabled.description: Indicates if the runtime policy is enabled or not.

enforce.description: Indicates that policy should effect container execution (not just for audit).

honeypot_apply_on.description: List of options to apply the honeypot on (Environment Vairable, Layer, File)

name.description: Name of the function runtime policy

scope_expression.description: Logical expression of how to compute the dependency of the scope variables.

application_scopes.description: Indicates the application scope of the service.

audit_all_os_user_activity.description: If true, all process activity will be audited.

audit_full_command_arguments.description: If true, full command arguments will be audited.

author.description: Username of the account that created the service.

blocked_files.description: List of files that are prevented from being read, modified and executed in the containers.

description.description: The description of the host runtime policy

enable_ip_reputation_security.description: If true, detect and prevent communication from containers to IP addresses known to have a bad reputation.

enabled.description: Indicates if the runtime policy is enabled or not.

enforce.description: Indicates that policy should effect container execution (not just for audit).

enforce_after_days.description: Indicates the number of days after which the runtime policy will be changed to enforce mode.

monitor_system_time_changes.description: If true, system time changes will be monitored.

monitor_windows_services.description: If true, windows service operations will be monitored.

name.description: Name of the host runtime policy

os_groups_allowed.description: List of OS (Linux or Windows) groups that are allowed to authenticate to the host, and block authentication requests from all others. Groups can be either Linux groups or Windows AD groups.

os_groups_blocked.description: List of OS (Linux or Windows) groups that are not allowed to authenticate to the host, and block authentication requests from all others. Groups can be either Linux groups or Windows AD groups.

os_users_allowed.description: List of OS (Linux or Windows) users that are allowed to authenticate to the host, and block authentication requests from all others.

os_users_blocked.description: List of OS (Linux or Windows) users that are not allowed to authenticate to the host, and block authentication requests from all others.

scope_expression.description: Logical expression of how to compute the dependency of the scope variables.

excluded_paths.description: List of paths to be excluded from being monitored.

excluded_processes.description: List of processes to be excluded from being monitored.

excluded_users.description: List of users to be excluded from being monitored.

monitor_attributes.description: If true, add attributes operations will be monitored.

monitor_create.description: If true, create operations will be monitored.

monitor_delete.description: If true, deletion operations will be monitored.

monitor_modify.description: If true, modification operations will be monitored.

monitor_read.description: If true, read operations will be monitored.

monitored_paths.description: List of paths to be monitored.

monitored_processes.description: List of processes to be monitored.

monitored_users.description: List of users to be monitored.

excluded_paths.description: List of paths to be excluded from being monitored.

excluded_processes.description: List of registry processes to be excluded from being monitored.

excluded_users.description: List of registry users to be excluded from being monitored.

monitor_attributes.description: If true, add attributes operations will be monitored.

monitor_create.description: If true, create operations will be monitored.

monitor_delete.description: If true, deletion operations will be monitored.

monitor_modify.description: If true, modification operations will be monitored.

monitor_read.description: If true, read operations will be monitored.

monitored_paths.description: List of paths to be monitored.

monitored_processes.description: List of registry processes to be monitored.

monitored_users.description: List of registry users to be monitored.

excluded_paths.description: List of registry paths to be excluded from being protected.

excluded_processes.description: List of registry processes to be excluded from being protected.

excluded_users.description: List of registry paths to be users from being protected.

protected_paths.description: List of registry paths to be protected.

protected_processes.description: List of registry processes to be protected.

protected_users.description: List of registry users to be protected.

allow_image.description: If this field is set to true, the image will be whitelisted.

assurance_checks_performed.description: The list of image assurance checks performed on the image.

author.description: The name of the user who registered the image.

block_image.description: If this field is set to true, the image will be blacklisted.

created.description: The date and time when the image was registered.

critical_vulnerabilities.description: Number of critical severity vulnerabilities detected in the image.

default_user.description: The default user of the image.

digest.description: The content digest of the image.

disallowed_by_assurance_checks.description: Whether the image was disallowed because of Image Assurance Policies.

docker_version.description: The Docker version used when building the image.

dta_skipped_reason.description: The reason why DTA was skipped.

high_vulnerabilities.description: Number of high severity vulnerabilities detected in the image.

history.description: The Docker history of the image.

image_size.description: The size of the image in bytes.

low_vulnerabilities.description: Number of low severity vulnerabilities detected in the image.

malware.description: Number of malware found on the image.

medium_vulnerabilities.description: Number of medium severity vulnerabilities detected in the image.

negligible_vulnerabilities.description: Number of negligible severity vulnerabilities detected in the image.

newer_image_exists.description: Whether a new version of the image is available in the registry but is not scanned and registered yet.

os.description: The operating system detected in the image

os_version.description: The version of the OS detected in the image.

parent.description: The ID of the parent image.

partial_results.description: Whether the image could only be partially scanned.

pending_disallowed.description: Whether the image is non-compliant, but is pending this status due to running containers.

permission_author.description: The name of the user who last modified the image permissions.

permission_comment.description: The comment provided when the image permissions were last modified

permission_modification_comment.description: A comment on why the image was whitelisted or blacklisted

registry.description: The name of the registry where the image is stored.

repository.description: The name of the image's repository.

scan_date.description: The date and time when the image was last scanned.

scan_error.description: If the image scan failed, the failure message.

scan_status.description: The scan status of the image (either 'pending', 'in_progress', 'finished', 'failed' or 'not_started').

sensitive_data.description: Number of sensitive data detected in the image.

total_vulnerabilities.description: The total number of vulnerabilities detected in the image.

virtual_size.description: The virtual size of the image.

vulnerabilities.description: A list of all the vulnerabilities found in the image

application_scopes.description: Indicates the application scope of the service.

author.description: Username of the account that created the service.

containers_count.description: The number of containers associated with the service.

description.description: A textual description of the service record; maximum 500 characters.

evaluated.description: Whether the service has been evaluated for security vulnerabilities.

lastupdate.description: Timestamp of the last update in Unix time format.

monitoring.description: Indicates if monitoring is enabled or not

name.description: The name of the service. It is recommended not to use whitespace characters in the name.

not_evaluated_count.description: The number of container that are not evaluated.

policies.description: The service's policies; an array of container firewall policy names.

scope_expression.description: Logical expression of how to compute the dependency of the scope variables.

target.description: Type of the workload. container or host.

unregistered_count.description: The number of containers allocated to the service that are not registered.

allowed_executables.description: List of executables that are allowed for the user.

audit_full_command_arguments.description: If true, full command arguments will be audited.

block_use_pid_namespace.description: If true, prevent containers from running with the privilege to use the PID namespace.
